Package ohos.distributedschedule.scenario

Class DistributedScenarioManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.distributedschedule.scenario.DistributedScenarioManager

  • public final class DistributedScenarioManager
extends Object
    A public class for subscribing to and unsubscribing from application status changes in distributed scenarios.

    During cross-device calling, applications can only make method calls in some particular distributed scenarios. This class allows your application to subscribe to desired scenarios and be notified upon scenario status changes. Based on the change information, your application can determine follow-up operations. Note that the notifications will only be sent to applications that have subscribed to corresponding scenarios.

    The methods provided by this class are all static and can be called without creating an object of this class.

    Since:
    3

    • Method Summary

      Subscribes to distributed scenarios.
      static void unsubscribe​(ScenarioSubscriber subscriber)

    • Method Detail

      • subscribe

        public static boolean subscribe​(ScenarioSubscriber subscriber)
        Subscribes to distributed scenarios. Your application will be notified upon status changes of the specified scenarios after the subscription is successful.

        Before calling this method, you should first create a child class of ScenarioSubscriber and override the ScenarioSubscriber#onScenarioNotify(ScenarioResult) method. The scenario status change result will be stored in ScenarioResult objects.

        To update subscribed scenarios, update the subscription information stored in SubscribeInfo and then call this method again.

        You are advised to use one ScenarioSubscriber object for your application to subscribe to scenarios. If too many ScenarioSubscriber objects are used, the subscription may fail.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the ScenarioSubscriber object containing the subscription information. This parameter cannot be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the subscription is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        unsubscribe(ScenarioSubscriber)

      • unsubscribe

        public static void unsubscribe​(ScenarioSubscriber subscriber)
        Unsubscribes from all previously subscribed distributed scenarios. Your application will no longer be notified upon any distributed scenario status changes after the unsubscription is successful.

        This method takes effect only after subscribe(ohos.distributedschedule.scenario.ScenarioSubscriber) has been called to subscribe to specific distributed scenarios.

        Generally, you subscribe to distributed scenarios by calling subscribe(ohos.distributedschedule.scenario.ScenarioSubscriber). If you do not want your application to be notified upon scenario status changes any longer, unsubscribe from these scenarios using this method.

        Parameters:
        subscriber - Indicates the ScenarioSubscriber object containing the subscription information. This parameter cannot be null.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        subscribe(ScenarioSubscriber)
